bibl.title: Reused Architectural Elements in Alexandrian Mosques and Cisterns.
bibl.note: Cisterns and mosques. - Typology of the reused elements [1. Corinthian and Corinthianising capitals; - 2. Ionic capitals; - 3. Composite capitals; - 4. Fluted capitals; - 5. Column bases and pedestals; - 6. Non-Classical architectural elements]. - Modes of incorporation of the spolia [Differential reuse: cisterns and mosques]. - Conclusion.

bibl.title: Egypt in the First Millennium AD. Perspectives from New Fieldwork

bibl.seg: Helen Fragaki, Reused Architectural Elements in Alexandrian Mosques and Cisterns.

Elisabeth R. O'Connell (ed.), Egypt in the First Millennium AD. Perspectives from New Fieldwork = British Museum Publications on Egypt and Sudan. 2 (Leuven - Paris - Walpole, MA, 2014) pp. 215-230, 19 figg. et pll. 1-2.

Cisterns and mosques. - Typology of the reused elements [1. Corinthian and Corinthianising capitals; - 2. Ionic capitals; - 3. Composite capitals; - 4. Fluted capitals; - 5. Column bases and pedestals; - 6. Non-Classical architectural elements]. - Modes of incorporation of the spolia [Differential reuse: cisterns and mosques]. - Conclusion.
